item.title: Fiona add a quote by George Washington
item.description: "Guard against the impostures of pretended patriotism." -- George Washington

item.title: Fiona add a quote by thomas paine
item.description: "Whatever is my right as a man is also the right of another; and it becomes my duty to guarantee as well as to possess." -- thomas paine

item.title: Fiona add a quote by George Washington
item.description: "There is nothing which can better deserve our patronage than the promotion of science and literature. Knowledge is in every country the surest basis of public happiness." -- George Washington

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Love never dies a natural death. It dies because we don't know how to replenish its source. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It dies of illness and wounds; it dies of weariness, of witherings, of tarnishings." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "You can never be overdressed or overeducated." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Patrick Henry
item.description: "Are we at last brought to such a humiliating and debasing degradation, that we cannot be trusted with arms for our own defense?" -- Patrick Henry

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Gerald R. Ford
item.description: "A government big enough to give you everything you want is a government big enough to take from you everything you have." -- Gerald R. Ford

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Bessie Anderson Stanley
Fiona add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "We in America do not have government by the majority. We have government by the majority who participate." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Men occasionally stumble over the truth, but most of them pick themselves up and hurry off as if nothing ever happened." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description:
"When the clergy addressed [author:General Washington|4356] on his departure from the government, it was observed in their consultation that he had never on any occasion said a word to the public which showed a belief in the Christian religion and they thought they should so pen their address as to force him at length to declare publicly whether he was a Christian or not. They did so. However [Dr. Rush] observed the old fox was too cunning for them. He answered every article of their address particularly except that, which he passed over without notice... I know that [author:Gouverneur Morris|945122], who pretended to be in his secrets & believed himself to be so, has often told me that <b>[author:General Washington|4356] believed no more of that system than he himself did</b>.
{<i>The Anas, February 1, 1800, written shortly after the death of first US president [author:George Washington|4356]</i>}" -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Fiona add a quote by John Philpot Curran
item.description: "The price of freedom is eternal vigilance." -- John Philpot Curran

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "Honesty is the first chapter of the book wisdom." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "There is no doubt that it is around the family and the home that all the greatest virtues, the most dominating virtues of human, are created, strengthened and maintained." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "My tastes are simple: I am easily satisfied with the best." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Continuous effort - not strength or intelligence - is the key to unlocking our potential." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Fiona add a quote by George Washington
item.description: "It is better to be alone than in bad company." -- George Washington

item.title: Fiona add a quote by George Washington
item.description: "A free people ought not only to be armed, but disciplined; to which end a uniform and well-digested plan is requisite; and their safety and interest require that they should promote such manufactories as tend to render them independent of others for essential, particularly military, supplies." -- George Washington

item.title: Fiona add a quote by George Washington
item.description: "Human happiness and moral duty are inseparably connected." -- George Washington

item.title: Fiona add a quote by George Washington
item.description: "A primary object should be the education of our youth in the science of government. In a republic, what species of knowledge can be equally important? And what duty more pressing than communicating it to those who are to be the future guardians of the liberties of the country?" -- George Washington

item.title: Fiona add a quote by George Washington
item.description: "Labor to keep alive in your breast that little spark of celestial fire called conscience." -- George Washington

item.title: Fiona add a quote by George Washington
item.description: "In politics as in philosophy, my tenets are few and simple. The leading one of which, and indeed that which embraces most others, is to be honest and just ourselves and to exact it from others, meddling as little as possible in their affairs where our own are not involved. If this maxim was generally adopted, wars would cease and our swords would soon be converted into reap hooks and our harvests be more peaceful, abundant, and happy." -- George Washington

item.title: Fiona add a quote by George Washington
item.description: "The great rule of conduct for us, in regard to foreign nations, is, in extending our commercial relations, to have with them as little political connection as possible." -- George Washington

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "A friend is a person with whom I may be sincere. Before him I may think aloud. I am arrived at last in the presence of a man so real and equal, that I may drop even those undermost garments of dissimulation, courtesy, and second thought, which men never put off, and may deal with him with the simplicity and wholeness with which one chemical atom meets another." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "You have just dined, and however scrupulously the slaughterhouse is concealed in the graceful distance of miles, there is complicity." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Every sweet has its sour; every evil its good." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Riding a horse is not a gentle hobby, to be picked up and laid down like a game of solitaire. It is a grand passion. It seizes a person whole and once it has done so, he/she will have to accept that his life will be radically changed." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson
